  • Villa
Chicagos Essex Inn
7.8 Very good
Based on 160 reviews

Without question, the staff at Essex Inn are beyond top notch and could fare well in a World Class hotel.

Michelle, as previously noted, is warm, kind, professional and goes the extra 5 miles to ensure comfort. I adore her. High marks for Fairis as well as a wonderful person and as helpful as can be. The entire staff were lovely. Housekeeping did their job well as the linens and towels were fresh and immaculate. In all honesty, the website pictures are a bit misleading as the hotel appears far more updated than it is. True, the shower runs hot and cold. Fair, the rooms could fare well with new wallpaper, a coat of paint and new carpet. Yes, the climate is not controllable. The second floor shows well with its updated fitness center and corporate rooms. If you want modern and perfect ( I know, who doesn't?!) this is not the place for you. But for budget-conscious travellers, this hotel is centrally located, immaculate and the staff make it fabulous. We would definitely return!!!!!

Show more
Wendie , Canada
Congress Plaza Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 260 reviews

There is no option for leisure so I had to select Solo, although I was travelling with my mum. We stayed 3 nights at the Congress Plaza Hotel.

The Hotel is located along S Michigan Ave, next to the Roosevelt University. The hotel is a short 7-10 minute walk to the Harrison Train station (Red Line) so that makes it easy to travel towards the city. If you do not mind walking, the walk up Michigan Ave and to the Magnificent Mile is nice. The hotel is across from Grant Park. Our room faced the train tracks so that could be a little noisy to some. The hotel and room interiors are rather tired but provided the necessary for a comfortable stay. The room size is a little smaller than some of the other hotels I stayed in on my trip but still reasonable. The front desk associate was unhelpful when we asked questions and immediately directed us to the Concierge (and no, she was not in a rush nor was there a line forming). The Concierge made recommendations on where we could catch the finals of the World Cup but unfortunately the sports bar was not opened at the time so we ended up watching it in the hotel's bar. He was however apologetic and suggested an alternative when we went back to inform him the sports bar was not opened. Overall, a good stay.

Show more
Li-lin , Singapore
Cambria hotel and suites Chicago Loop - Theatre District
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 6 reviews

IVY Boutique Hotel Chicago
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 60 reviews

I recommend the king suit. it comes with a separate room with basic office furniture, sofa and TV. The blind and the curtain can be control by the switch.

The bathtub is pretty large must try. The location is also nice,no more than 2 miles from all the Chicago landmark. However, the WiFi is not free, it is $9 for 24 hours. I didn't try any food in the restaurant, but there are a lot of good restaurant nearby.

Show more
KACHI , Hong Kong
Freehand Chicago
8.4 Excellent
Based on 66 reviews

My stay was comfortable. The dorms were very small to move around, especially with big lugguages. The room is very clean and so is the shower.

Love the lockers in the room. All staffs are helpful and friendly, except for one staff named Evelyn who was not so professional over the phone. I loved the cozy cafe area/ lounge! The cafes food was delicious but $9 for a slice of toast with avocado is a price that five star hotel charges! Nice of them to provide free simple breakfast. I did not eat their breakfast because the basement smells really bad as soon as you get to the stairs. The smell is so nasty I had to hold my breath. It is not a good sign with a basement that smells like that. I liked everything about the hotel except for the basement and the hallway( the 16th floor) just a little dark, narrow and with pipes hanging down the ceiling.

Show more
Pearl , United States
Hyatt Regency Mccormick Place
10 Exceptional
Based on 3 reviews

Inn of Chicago
7.7 Very good
Based on 151 reviews

I love the hotel decoration and easy to go around. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel. There are also many restaurants around the hotel too.

But, the staff was not helpful I have to wait to check in until 3 pm. But, I was wondering why they let other people check in but kept telling me I have to wait. My room was not ready. I think may be I am an Asian girl so they don't treat me like white peole..so bad service at front desk!

Show more
punchada , Thailand
Hyatt Regency Chicago
8.2 Excellent
Based on 37 reviews

When I arrived there was no one to take care of our luggage and carry them to our rooms and when we checked – in we found out that the room does not match with our reservation it was smaller and with no view although our booking was highlighting that the room size is 40 sq.

m with a river view. After long discussion with the front disk employee, he advised me that my booking is standard as shown in their system and I need to contact my travel Agent. It was almost 11:00 Friday night and no one was responding from Agoda customer services. The front disk employee was very rude and un-helpful although I showed them all paperwork that confirmed my reservation. When my voice becomes high and I started becoming frustrated and started giving them few words about how the customer services supposed to be, and they should understand that I should be out of any dispute between the hotel and the Agoda. Finally after 30 min of discussion and arguments they decided to give me the room that match my reservation. Really, it was avery bad experience with this hotel…

Show more
MUHAMMAD , Saudi Arabia
Cambria Hotel & Suites Chicago Magnificent Mile
9 Excellent
Based on 6 reviews

Best Western Grant Park Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 38 reviews

Before we arrived at the hotel I double-checked with agoda if there will be any tax to be charged from the hotel.

I got a confirmation that charges is included in hotel tax. One day before arrival I called the hotel directly to check if my reservation was known and if we had two beds as the meaning of double bed was unsure to me. The hotel confirmed my reservation and that two beds were in the room. On our arrival we have been greeted and checked in. The room was pretty small but we didn't want to stay in the room the whole day anyway. When asking how to get to Oakbrook mall or Stratford mall we have been told to go by cab as it was not possible to go by train or bus. We trusted the info and paid 50 usd to get to the first mall. When we wanted to go the the other mall we paid another 40 usd and found out later that there was a bus going to a Metra-station where a train was going to down-town Chicago....you can imagine we were quite unhappy with the info the hotel provided. Also when we asked for coin laundry they could not give any info., when asking how much a cab to airport would be they couldn't answer. What kind of a hotel is this?? For me these are standard questions which should be answered with ease. The nice thing was free Internet but that's about it. The location on south Michigan is pretty good if you want to go shopping on State street or north Michigan. State street is better for shopping. ask for special visitor card at Macy's and Bloomingdales so you can save 11% tax except for cosmetics and other selected items.

Show more
Helena , Afghanistan
Best Western PLUS Chicago Hillside
8.6 Excellent
Based on 8 reviews

Comfort Suites
8.5 Excellent
Based on 15 reviews

The Willows Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 10 reviews

ACME Hotel Company
8.7 Excellent
Based on 9 reviews

Hilton Chicago Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 62 reviews

Pros: Starbucks, small shop are inside the hotel. Huge pool and nice Jacuzzi (5am to 9pm) Close to the cloud gate and the art institute of Chicago.

(about 10 mins walk) Quick check out, you just need to drop the keys in the box in front of the front desk. Just renovated, so quite clean. Cons: The closest station, Harrison station, was closed when we stayed. We had to walk 10 mins to Jackson station to get to the metro. There is no airport shuttle bus service, but it takes 45mins from O'Hare international airport. No mini bar (small fridge) $2 for storage of luggage

Show more
Yoko , Japan
dana hotel and spa
8.7 Excellent
Based on 13 reviews

Comfort Suites O'Hare Airport
7.8 Very good
Based on 49 reviews

My stay at this hotel was horrible. The staff is incompetent. Before even arriving at this hotel, I was already off to a bad start because my airport transfer never arrived even though I have called 24 hours before to book the transport and explained that I was an international traveller without a local mobile phone.

I had to borrow someone's phone to call the hotel and request they send the transport. After arriving and checking in, the lady at the front desk stared at be blankly when I asked her for help to get my suitcases to my room. I had to struggle to get my bags up to the room. The room itself was pretty disappointing as it looked nothing like the pictures online. No fresh water was provided in the room. We were asked to pay extra for bottles of water which I found odd for a three star hotel. The music from the bar downstairs blared until very late at night making falling asleep very difficult at this hotel. There are other hotels in the area which are better value and I wish I had stayed there. I will not be staying here again. One of the staff members did not even know the difference between am and pm and looked at my passport as if it was an ancient relic. Finally, the fact that breakfast ends at 9:00 is also too early. In my travels, I have found that it is standard to have breakfast until at least 10:00. I arrived at 9:10 and was told I could not eat . I left this hotel feeling tired and annoyed. I would never stay here again, not even if you paid me.

Show more
Francois-Xavier , France
Majestic Hotel Chicago
7 Very good
Based on 7 reviews

Quality Inn O'Hare Airport
6.9 Good
Based on 35 reviews

We spent one night in the Quality Inn O´Hare because we needed to sleep close to the airport. The Hotel is a smoking hotel so you can imagine the smell.

Unfortunately we had a smokers room and it was disgusting. Worste of all was the service. We had a man at the reception who was the rudest person I have ever come across. Allthough the hotel is near to the airport and it might sound like a deal...don´t do t his to yourself!

Show more
Vanessa , United Kingdom
Comfort Suites Michigan Avenue - Loop
8.3 Excellent
Based on 20 reviews

The Godfrey Hotel Chicago
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 9 reviews

Best Western River North Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 32 reviews

The hotel looks rundown on the outside but it had nice interiors when you get in, especially the rooms.

Rooms were spacious and well-kept. The hotel is near to everything. Just a few blocks away from Grand station (Red Line), near Hard Rock Cafe, Nordstrom and a couple of good restaurants like Portillos and Rainforest Cafe. It's a couple of blocks away from Lou Malnati's as well. My only beef with this hotel is that I was FORCED to pay a deposit (50usd a day + tax) and the hotel staff just swipe my card. No option for cash payment. Until now, they haven't refunded my deposit even though the front desk assured me. Emailed them a couple of times to no avail. So yeah, they SCREWED me over that deposit. Good bye 150USD. So f*ck you lady receptionist for not returning my money!

Show more
Matthew , Philippines
Palmer House a Hilton Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 55 reviews

The historic lobby is nice, to see it once, then it's alike a shopping mall on a busy day, all the time, dark as a casino, no windows.

We had to ask to change rooms, a simple conversation from your neighbors can be heard 100%, wifi didn't work well(come on guys, it's 2016!), 80% of electric plugs don't work so keep an eye all night if you want to charge your smartphones while you sleep. This could be a great stop for a tour but this is NOT a Hilton experience

Show more
Horacio , United States
City Suites Chicago
6.4 Good
Based on 2 reviews

Hotel Felix
8.1 Excellent
Based on 13 reviews

Chicago Lake Shore Hotel
6.5 Good
Based on 19 reviews

Comfort Inn Arlington Heights - O'Hare
6.4 Good
Based on 1 reviews

Best Western at OHare
7 Very good
Based on 24 reviews

no problems with the hotel itself but the ground floor has been entirely gutted not giving a comfortable first impression.

Van that collects passengers from ORD has Radisson written on the front but no Best Western, I ended up waiting 45min for the same bus to come around a second time. Staff did call out the name of the hotel(s) but if you're not expecting it, you may not hear the announcement by the driver. check in staff were fine. Lifts are antiquated and I did have a moment where I feared that I was stuck in a lift. Corridors are long. (I was in the very last room) Inconvenient, yes. Showstopper No. Sportsbar was good. good selection of beers on tap. just about every sport available on the multiple screens. Steak dinner I had was well cooked. WIFI was strong enough to have Skype call.

Show more
Alexander , Canada
Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile
8.3 Excellent
Based on 79 reviews

I had a very pleasant short stay at the Hilton Garden Inn, Chicago. The best part is that I know I wouldn't need my car to stroll around the city center.

All are close to the hotel. The location is simply great! The room itself is CLEAN and Tidy! From the time I arrived and checked-in to the hotel, I had a good experience. Free Wifi at the lobby area is great too. One of the most stunning features that the hotel has, in fact this is the first time I saw this feature in a hotel, is the fact that the bed's softness and hardness can be adjusted manually! This really really helped my parents adjusting their bed preferrence. The receptionists as well as the concierge people were very helpful in giving us some of the city's insights as well as food recommendations. They even had a list of food recommendation ready for you with their own review. I am so glad for this!

Just viewed by other Agoda travelers

Best Western PLUS Chicago Hillside
8.6 Excellent
Based on 8 reviews
Motel 6 Melrose Park, IL
5.5 Review score
Based on 157 reviews

Traveler impressions of Chicago (IL)

chicago is one of the best and famous cities in USA you should not miss checking out but make sure you have a lot of money because you'll surely drool over the shopping district

Moleta ,Philippines

Public transportation is very good, architecture is varied and interesting, recommend Millennium Park, Art Institute, Willis (Sears) Tower, MLB

LANE ,United States

A wonderful high rise city. Excellent and varied buildings. Interesting sightseeing tours and many places to visit.

Well known for making Batman films using the buildings and the lower level roads.

Show more
Pavitt ,United Kingdom

a city full of energy and vibrancy....excellent place to visit for a respite for relaxation and rejuventaion.

.even in the winter months such as when this brief getaway was taken

Show more
Van Elden ,United States

Chicago is the second best city in the US. It is called as windy city and it is true. Spectacular downtown with viewpoint on some of them.

The first hour for parking cost 21 bucks, and the addition hours cost +3, but early birds discouth is avaible. Great lakeside.

Show more
Varga ,Hungary

Chicago has such a diverse population and offers something for anyone to find enjoyment while visiting.

They offer baseball, basketball and football for the sports minded. There are plenty of places to shop and eat. I love the museum campus with all it has to offer.

Show more
Stayton ,United States

Chicago has lots of good restaurants to offer, fancy restaurants, hot dog, pizza...everything you feel like.

Uchida ,Canada

The night view of John Hancock is great. The boat Cruise is also great. In Museum Campus you can take good pictures.

Fan ,Taiwan

Great city. Would go back again. Lots to see. Architectural River Cruise very informative and gives you a great feel for the city.

friendly people, would definitely recommend my friends visit Chicago.

More about Chicago (IL)

When people mention famous American cities, Chicago is often on the list. There is a reason that this American metropolis has stood the test of time and remained a world-class destination, and a lot of its popularity has to do with the heart and personality of this city.

Chicago O’Hare International Airport is the bigger international airport, located less than 20 miles from the city center and serving flights from pretty much every corner of the world.

From the first moment of arriving in Chicago, visitors will be spoiled for things to do and sights to see. Just a stroll along the famous Magnificent Mile, with its many shops and restaurants along one of the most famous retail and entertainment districts in the world. With Lake Michigan fronting the city’s skyline and Michigan Avenue hugging its shore, Chicago has no shortage of picturesque views. This city is often referred to as the birthplace of the skyscraper, and the view from Millennium Park is the perfect way to fully appreciate the beauty of the tall buildings that call Chicago home. The world's first steel-and-concrete skyscraper rose over the Chicago skyline in the 19th century, and many visitors consider a trip to the top of the Sears Tower a must-do while visiting this city.

Chicago is a bastion of blues and jazz, and some of the best clubs are here in the North Side. Diehard fans of blues will want to time their visit with the annual Chicago Blues Festival, held in June of every year. Home of the Wrigley Field, Frank Lloyd Wright Home, and many of the best blues clubs in the world, Chicago is a feast for the senses.

For more information on hotels and landmarks in the different areas of Chicago, take a look at the interactive map on this page and start planning the perfect vacation in this incredible city.

LinkPoints Programme Qatar Airways Privilege Club reward-U Royal Skies Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer SkyPearl Club SM Advantage/ BDO Rewards Thai Airways Royal Orchid Plus The 1 Card Thailand TudoAzul United MileagePlus Velocity Frequent Flyer WAON POINT Featured Hotels Hotel Resort Guest House Apartment Villa Chicagos Essex Inn 7.8 Very good Based on 160 reviews Without question, the staff at Essex Inn are beyond top notch and could fare well in a World Class hotel. Michelle, as previously noted, is warm, kind, professional and goes the extra 5 miles to ensure comfort. I adore her. High marks for Fairis as well as a wonderful person and as helpful as can be. The entire staff were lovely. Housekeeping did their job well as the linens and towels were fresh and immaculate. In all honesty, the website pictures are a bit misleading as the hotel appears far more updated than it is. True, the shower runs hot and cold. Fair, the rooms could fare well with new wallpaper, a coat of paint and new carpet. Yes, the climate is not controllable. The second floor shows well with its updated fitness center and corporate rooms. If you want modern and perfect ( I know, who doesn't?!) this is not the place for you. But for budget-conscious travellers, this hotel is centrally located, immaculate and the staff make it fabulous. We would definitely return!!!!! Show more Wendie , Canada Congress Plaza Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 260 reviews There is no option for leisure so I had to select Solo, although I was travelling with my mum. We stayed 3 nights at the Congress Plaza Hotel. The Hotel is located along S Michigan Ave, next to the Roosevelt University. The hotel is a short 7-10 minute walk to the Harrison Train station (Red Line) so that makes it easy to travel towards the city. If you do not mind walking, the walk up Michigan Ave and to the Magnificent Mile is nice. The hotel is across from Grant Park. Our room faced the train tracks so that could be a little noisy to some. The hotel and room interiors are rather tired but provided the necessary for a comfortable stay. The room size is a little smaller than some of the other hotels I stayed in on my trip but still reasonable. The front desk associate was unhelpful when we asked questions and immediately directed us to the Concierge (and no, she was not in a rush nor was there a line forming). The Concierge made recommendations on where we could catch the finals of the World Cup but unfortunately the sports bar was not opened at the time so we ended up watching it in the hotel's bar. He was however apologetic and suggested an alternative when we went back to inform him the sports bar was not opened. Overall, a good stay. Show more Li-lin , Singapore Cambria hotel and suites Chicago Loop - Theatre District 9.1 Exceptional Based on 6 reviews IVY Boutique Hotel Chicago 9.2 Exceptional Based on 60 reviews I recommend the king suit. it comes with a separate room with basic office furniture, sofa and TV. The blind and the curtain can be control by the switch. The bathtub is pretty large must try. The location is also nice,no more than 2 miles from all the Chicago landmark. However, the WiFi is not free, it is $9 for 24 hours. I didn't try any food in the restaurant, but there are a lot of good restaurant nearby. Show more KACHI , Hong Kong Freehand Chicago 8.4 Excellent Based on 66 reviews My stay was comfortable. The dorms were very small to move around, especially with big lugguages. The room is very clean and so is the shower. Love the lockers in the room. All staffs are helpful and friendly, except for one staff named Evelyn who was not so professional over the phone. I loved the cozy cafe area/ lounge! The cafes food was delicious but $9 for a slice of toast with avocado is a price that five star hotel charges! Nice of them to provide free simple breakfast. I did not eat their breakfast because the basement smells really bad as soon as you get to the stairs. The smell is so nasty I had to hold my breath. It is not a good sign with a basement that smells like that. I liked everything about the hotel except for the basement and the hallway( the 16th floor) just a little dark, narrow and with pipes hanging down the ceiling. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel. There are also many restaurants around the hotel too. But, the staff was not helpful I have to wait to check in until 3 pm. But, I was wondering why they let other people check in but kept telling me I have to wait. My room was not ready. I think may be I am an Asian girl so they don't treat me like white peole..so bad service at front desk! Show more punchada , Thailand Hyatt Regency Chicago 8.2 Excellent Based on 37 reviews When I arrived there was no one to take care of our luggage and carry them to our rooms and when we checked – in we found out that the room does not match with our reservation it was smaller and with no view although our booking was highlighting that the room size is 40 sq. m with a river view. After long discussion with the front disk employee, he advised me that my booking is standard as shown in their system and I need to contact my travel Agent. It was almost 11:00 Friday night and no one was responding from Agoda customer services. The front disk employee was very rude and un-helpful although I showed them all paperwork that confirmed my reservation. When my voice becomes high and I started becoming frustrated and started giving them few words about how the customer services supposed to be, and they should understand that I should be out of any dispute between the hotel and the Agoda. Finally after 30 min of discussion and arguments they decided to give me the room that match my reservation. Really, it was avery bad experience with this hotel… Show more MUHAMMAD , Saudi Arabia Cambria Hotel & Suites Chicago Magnificent Mile 9 Excellent Based on 6 reviews Best Western Grant Park Hotel 7.8 Very good Based on 38 reviews Before we arrived at the hotel I double-checked with agoda if there will be any tax to be charged from the hotel. I got a confirmation that charges is included in hotel tax. One day before arrival I called the hotel directly to check if my reservation was known and if we had two beds as the meaning of double bed was unsure to me. The hotel confirmed my reservation and that two beds were in the room. On our arrival we have been greeted and checked in. The room was pretty small but we didn't want to stay in the room the whole day anyway. When asking how to get to Oakbrook mall or Stratford mall we have been told to go by cab as it was not possible to go by train or bus. We trusted the info and paid 50 usd to get to the first mall. When we wanted to go the the other mall we paid another 40 usd and found out later that there was a bus going to a Metra-station where a train was going to down-town Chicago....you can imagine we were quite unhappy with the info the hotel provided. Also when we asked for coin laundry they could not give any info., when asking how much a cab to airport would be they couldn't answer. What kind of a hotel is this?? For me these are standard questions which should be answered with ease. The nice thing was free Internet but that's about it. The location on south Michigan is pretty good if you want to go shopping on State street or north Michigan. State street is better for shopping. ask for special visitor card at Macy's and Bloomingdales so you can save 11% tax except for cosmetics and other selected items. Show more Helena , Afghanistan Best Western PLUS Chicago Hillside 8.6 Excellent Based on 8 reviews Comfort Suites 8.5 Excellent Based on 15 reviews The Willows Hotel 8.2 Excellent Based on 10 reviews ACME Hotel Company 8.7 Excellent Based on 9 reviews Hilton Chicago Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 62 reviews Pros: Starbucks, small shop are inside the hotel. Huge pool and nice Jacuzzi (5am to 9pm) Close to the cloud gate and the art institute of Chicago. (about 10 mins walk) Quick check out, you just need to drop the keys in the box in front of the front desk. Just renovated, so quite clean. Cons: The closest station, Harrison station, was closed when we stayed. We had to walk 10 mins to Jackson station to get to the metro. There is no airport shuttle bus service, but it takes 45mins from O'Hare international airport. No mini bar (small fridge) $2 for storage of luggage Show more Yoko , Japan dana hotel and spa 8.7 Excellent Based on 13 reviews Comfort Suites O'Hare Airport 7.8 Very good Based on 49 reviews My stay at this hotel was horrible. The staff is incompetent. Before even arriving at this hotel, I was already off to a bad start because my airport transfer never arrived even though I have called 24 hours before to book the transport and explained that I was an international traveller without a local mobile phone. I had to borrow someone's phone to call the hotel and request they send the transport. After arriving and checking in, the lady at the front desk stared at be blankly when I asked her for help to get my suitcases to my room. I had to struggle to get my bags up to the room. The room itself was pretty disappointing as it looked nothing like the pictures online. No fresh water was provided in the room. We were asked to pay extra for bottles of water which I found odd for a three star hotel. The music from the bar downstairs blared until very late at night making falling asleep very difficult at this hotel. There are other hotels in the area which are better value and I wish I had stayed there. I will not be staying here again. One of the staff members did not even know the difference between am and pm and looked at my passport as if it was an ancient relic. Finally, the fact that breakfast ends at 9:00 is also too early. In my travels, I have found that it is standard to have breakfast until at least 10:00. I arrived at 9:10 and was told I could not eat . I left this hotel feeling tired and annoyed. I would never stay here again, not even if you paid me. The Hotel is a smoking hotel so you can imagine the smell. Unfortunately we had a smokers room and it was disgusting. Worste of all was the service. We had a man at the reception who was the rudest person I have ever come across. Allthough the hotel is near to the airport and it might sound like a deal...don´t do t his to yourself! Rooms were spacious and well-kept. The hotel is near to everything. Just a few blocks away from Grand station (Red Line), near Hard Rock Cafe, Nordstrom and a couple of good restaurants like Portillos and Rainforest Cafe. It's a couple of blocks away from Lou Malnati's as well. My only beef with this hotel is that I was FORCED to pay a deposit (50usd a day + tax) and the hotel staff just swipe my card. No option for cash payment. Until now, they haven't refunded my deposit even though the front desk assured me. Emailed them a couple of times to no avail. So yeah, they SCREWED me over that deposit. Good bye 150USD. So f*ck you lady receptionist for not returning my money! We had to ask to change rooms, a simple conversation from your neighbors can be heard 100%, wifi didn't work well(come on guys, it's 2016!), 80% of electric plugs don't work so keep an eye all night if you want to charge your smartphones while you sleep. The best part is that I know I wouldn't need my car to stroll around the city center. All are close to the hotel. The location is simply great! The room itself is CLEAN and Tidy! From the time I arrived and checked-in to the hotel, I had a good experience. Free Wifi at the lobby area is great too. One of the most stunning features that the hotel has, in fact this is the first time I saw this feature in a hotel, is the fact that the bed's softness and hardness can be adjusted manually! This really really helped my parents adjusting their bed preferrence. Show more Kurniadjaja ,Indonesia Discover the neighborhoods of Chicago (IL) Loop 232 hotels River North 111 hotels Magnificent Mile 100 hotels O`Hare International Airport 88 hotels Schaumburg 78 hotels Lake View 62 hotels Lincoln Park 60 hotels Wicker Park 53 hotels West O'Hare 46 hotels Chicago Midway International Airport 39 hotels North Chicago 38 hotels West Town 31 hotels West Loop 28 hotels Elmhurst 22 hotels Uptown 21 hotels North O'Hare 18 hotels Old Town 16 hotels Orland Grassland 15 hotels South O'Hare 14 hotels McCormick Place 13 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Chicago (IL) 344 Serviced Apartments in Chicago (IL) 23 Motels in Chicago (IL) 13 Hostels in Chicago (IL) 7 More about Chicago (IL) When people mention famous American cities, Chicago is often on the list. There is a reason that this American metropolis has stood the test of time and remained a world-class destination, and a lot of its popularity has to do with the heart and personality of this city. Chicago O’Hare International Airport is the bigger international airport, located less than 20 miles from the city center and serving flights from pretty much every corner of the world. From the first moment of arriving in Chicago, visitors will be spoiled for things to do and sights to see. Just a stroll along the famous Magnificent Mile , with its many shops and restaurants along one of the most famous retail and entertainment districts in the world. With Lake Michigan fronting the city’s skyline and Michigan Avenue hugging its shore, Chicago has no shortage of picturesque views. This city is often referred to as the birthplace of the skyscraper, and the view from Millennium Park is the perfect way to fully appreciate the beauty of the tall buildings that call Chicago home. The world's first steel-and-concrete skyscraper rose over the Chicago skyline in the 19th century, and many visitors consider a trip to the top of the Sears Tower a must-do while visiting this city. Chicago is a bastion of blues and jazz, and some of the best clubs are here in the North Side. Diehard fans of blues will want to time their visit with the annual Chicago Blues Festival, held in June of every year. Home of the Wrigley Field, Frank Lloyd Wright Home , and many of the best blues clubs in the world, Chicago is a feast for the senses. For more information on hotels and landmarks in the different areas of Chicago, take a look at the interactive map on this page and start planning the perfect vacation in this incredible city.
